The price/output decision for monopolistic competition is illustrated in Figure 10. Panel
(a) of Figure 10 illustrates the short-run priceloutput characteristics of monopolistic
competition for a single firm. As indicated, firms in monopolistic competition maximize
economic profits by producing where marginal revenue (MR) equals marginal cost
(MC), and by charging the price for that quantity from the demand curve, D. Here
the firm earns positive economic profits because price, P", exceeds average total cost,
ATC". Due to low barriers to entry, competitors will enter the market in pursuit of these
economic profits.
